author: Alexander Watanabe
title: Decentralized Event-Risk Contracts
description: Insurance is one of the oldest financial products. Hedging against risk is fundamental to life and business, yet it is a overly complicated.

assessments.note: This proposal fails to benchmark any existing traditional finance insurance products or even discuss the clear legacy touch points that would need to exist for this app to operate at any level of scale cross-jurisdiction. This is not a scalable proposal that makes Cardano more competitive in the next 6 months.
An insurance dApp proposal this complex requires more technical documentation or a Whitepaper describing the protocol in depth, this proposal is lacking depth

Beyond the high-level implementation section its not at all clear where the technical documentation, WP or other information describing this protocol exists. Also not clear who the developers building smart contracts will be w/o Github links to properly vet.
besides the lacking documentation, the project plan reads more like a concept plan and the implementation needs to be followed up with a detailed budget breakdown/project roadmap.
Budgetary requirements are not addressed in much detail nor other ideas about how this project plans to execute in the short-medium term in actually developing on Cardano.

This proposal is missing much of the information a complete dApp should have included in their proposal: technical docs, detailed project plan, budget, benchmark and metrics to track the project into implementation.

solution: Make an insurance marketplace where insurers and policyholders enter into contracts, initially based on on-chain data with Oracles ASAP.
